sections.heading: Process Design
sections.content:
I used collaborative methods to shape a best practice marketing planning process derived from customer understanding work I had undertaken.

This included a BPMN versions of the processes that captured high level requirements for the customer journey and showed the orchestration of reusable sub-processes.

sections.heading: Personas and Use Case Mapping
sections.content:
Utilising interviews, contextual inquiry, and surveys I had developed a good deal of understanding of the people, processes, and technology involved in marketing planning.

As part developing customer journey documentation I developed user group personas which I mapped to the use cases involved in the marketing planning process. This work also formed a basis of identity and permission management requirements within the process.

sections.heading: Sketches
sections.content: I made several hundred sketches based on the customer understanding and business requirements. The approach included modularity as a key goal.

sections.heading: Responsive Prototype
sections.content:
To get a feel for the viability delivering the product as a responsive web application I created a prototype of the primary screens the use cases would require.

I used Bootstrap and an implementation of Material Design to develop an HTML prototype.
